Reviews.Content: This is where I belong!       the drinks are great!
Reviews.Author: ALx2

Reviews.Content: Dirty and loud - get what you pay for We stayed at the Barong for three night and were not pleased. Whilst the staff were helpful the facilities were poor and needed serious work. We were put in a dodgy room down the back which was dirty, damp smelling and with a bed that was incredibly saggy. It was also next to the pool bar which was noisy to all hours. We complained and were happily moved to a room away from the pool which was cleaner and quieter, This is a cheap hotel and it is difficult to see what it was like on the net. This would be the place to stay if you were drunk every night and didn't care about facilities as it was close to the main Kuta drag. Do not stay here if you are not a drunken Austalian yob!
Reviews.Author: sam_ham_01

Reviews.Content: Cheap hotel in Excellent Location Enjoyed our stay at the barong. Sevice was excellent and has great 24hr swim up bar. Room was very basic, the bathroom was a bit dodgy, but fairly clean. Facilities are good.You get what you pay for, so we were not expecting anything flash. Great location, close to shopping, bars etc. I would stay there again if I was on a budget. Don't go there expecting a high class hotel as it is classed as a budget style hotel. Great if you just want somewhere comfy to sleep in a central location.
Reviews.Author: pandanrobbo

Reviews.Content: First stay at Barong We stayed at the Barong for 7 nights. It is cheap and you get what you pay for. The pool and garden areas are great. You can have massages by the pool which was relaxing. The rooms are just average but clean and room service is quick if you call. They give you clean sheets and towels everyday. Breakfast was pretty basic but plenty there and the staff are all friendly and helpful. Look for Adam out the front to drive you to some great spots he is great fun and nothing is a problem.We will go back again soon!
Reviews.Author: weluvbali

Reviews.Content: Loved the Barong My stay from 24th June till 9th July 2008 was very pleasant. The staff were excellent and would do anything for you to ensure your stay was very comfortable. They certainly looked after me after a fall and injuring my ankle. They went beyond the call of duty for me. I would stay again with no hesitation. Thank you to all at Barong.
Reviews.Author: happytravellerPerth

Reviews.Content: Great little hotel       Looking from the pool to our room
Reviews.Author: Ozziemate

Reviews.Content: great location We stayed at the Barong for a few nights in July 2007. Its in a handy (but very busy) location although once you enter the grounds of the hotel you can forget about the busy street outside as the gardens are pretty. The staff are friendly and the massages, manicures and pedicures that the 2 ladies do in the garden are great and really cheap.The rooms are basic but the hotel is very cheap (拢14 a night bed and breakfast for 2 of us).Reception have a list of DVDs and when you request one, you can watch it in your room - it is shown in all rooms at the same time so if someone else beats you to it, you will have to watch their choice of film.Our one problem was that we booked the hotel car to take us to the airport at 6am but when we went to reception they told us that although the car was there, the driver didn't come on duty until 7am!!! Why did they let us book the car? At that time in the morning there are no taxis on the street so one of the hotel staff managed to contact a friend of his who had an old battered taxi and he took us to the aiport (but charged us the same as we were to pay for the hotel car) - at that point we weren't in a position to argue.All in all, we enjoyed our stay at the Barong.
Reviews.Author: Angie-Bruce

Reviews.Content: the loud drunken louts hotel My wife and I have just returned from Bali. We stayed at the Barong hotel from the 10th march to the 24 march. It is noisey, dirty, the facilities are a bare minimum. Drunken Aussie louts screaming shouting and using obscene language till 3am every night .Loud music all day till around 10pm.The security people will not do anything about the situation.The staff were very, very good. How they put up with the abuse I don't know. We will inform our travel agent about the situation at the Barong so that they can warn people going to Bali for a quiet, relaxing holiday to steer clear of the Barong Hotel.Barry.
Reviews.Author: barnor

Reviews.Content: worst choice in Kuta Room is basic, a lot of times they forget to give you towels.Someone STOLE MY MONEY (300euros) from my room locked.Stupid me to have money in the room but you don't expect in Bali to be stolen something!Money were very well hidden so someone went there with the intention to stole.I reported to the hotel the fact and they told me it is impossible.Can you believe it?????????????????????????I highly reccomed to chose another place to stay in Bali!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: spanishchica

Reviews.Content: hope it gets better Having stayed here on two other ocassions the last being three years ago i thought i was would be set for a good stay was i wrong.plumbing shut down for three hours,every night no towels from lunch time until ten oclock at night,important messages were not passed on,free breakfast better off buying somewhere else,hotel door big gap at top inch high lets the mossquitos in,the ceiling in the bedroom plus bathroom were covered in mould[have photos for proof]ceiling collapsing.The main problem not that its there fault is the amount of unpaid trainees outweighed the qualified staff.This is not meant as adeterent the people are beautiful the surroundings are heaven it is true paradise if the hotel renovated one room at a time in the front wing to match the quality of rooms at the rear of the complex it would be truley worthy of a three star rating as it stands i would give it two stars at the most.For the hotel please attend to room 208.just a little bit of advice if renovating add an extra power point in rooms .
Reviews.Author: PerthTravellinman

Reviews.Content: Loved it If you're after a good, friendly, well priced hotel in a great location, this is the place to stay.We stayed at the Barong Hotel from March 1st 2007 for 7 nights. Initially there was 12 of us and another 2 arrived later that night when the hotel was in Karaoke mode out the back in the restaurant. It was absolutely teeming down with rain but there was about 40 people in total all having a great time. The location of the hotel is brilliant, about 5 minutes walk each way out the front to the beach or the night life. The staff are very friendly and our older adult son  his friends had poor old Wayan running up and down the stairs all night with drinks from the back bar ( open 24hrs). Wayan or Wang as they called him became great friends with us all.The breakfast was nothing special but was adequate and if you want, there are numerous restaurants within a stones throw that have cheap breakfast.Some of the rooms are better than others, so don't be afraid to ask for another room if you're not happy with what you get. It's basically just a room to sleep for a few hours. The back area is better than the front and you feel miles away from the hustle  bustle out there.We moved to another good hotel ( already pre booked )near the Waterbom Park after 7 days which was much bigger and closer to the beach, but lacked the friendliness  closeness. Next time we go back, we will be staying at the Barong again, but for longer this time.
Reviews.Author: OldMate

Reviews.Content: Didnt like the Barong The Barong is very cheap and you get what you pay for.The room was very basic. The bathroom was terrible. The shower was right next to the toilet. So when you showered you were standing on the same tiles as you would be if you were going to the toilet. This is not very hygenic.The hotel was full of Bali Bogans on a cheap holiday.We checked out pretty soon after we checked in and tried to get some of our money back. They would not refund any money.
Reviews.Author: balitravel-07

Reviews.Content: Best value for money and the staff treat you like family ....... I have stayed at the Bali Barong on many occasions, and other hotels, but still Return to the Barong, due to the friendly staff and helpful in any quiries that may rise through-out the stay. over the years I have made close friend ships with I prefer to state that some of the staff , I would prefer to call my family. It's now the 12th Of Feb 2007, and i have made contact with my friends to inform them of my return. ( Why ? Because the Barong is the Best) and close to all the nightlife, shopping,beach,cafes).Bali is my second home, and the Barong is where i call home when staying there.Now on any chance you decide to book, with the Barong...... REQUEST a room at the rear section as it is Newer than the front. Note the pool and swim up bar is excellent. Speaking of bar......If you do stay there, Ask for Georgie and tell him MR.Browne sent you ......! can't miss him, as he's the bloke behind the bar, named bar Captain, OH.........and the brightest white smile that you have ever seen.Hope this helps your decision making, have fun and who knows ya might just bump into me aswell.
Reviews.Author: bwb123

Reviews.Content: Great Value, Fun Crowd My partner and I stayed at Hotel Barong in Dec 2005. We'd previously being staying at the Balisani Padma in Legian for a week (crap no atmosphere, no people, too many staff yet crap service - and I'm no princess! I dont need much) when we'd had enough and stumbled upon the Barong. Only wish we moved there earlier.There are two areas. The front pool with rooms surrounding this, then the back pool. Although you're in the heart of Kuta, you are in a lush area with a 24 hour pool bar, there are always people about. The back area is definately better to stay in. The front section is too enclosed and it makes for dark damp rooms.The room itself was very clean -although the 1st one we got was in a dark area and had a musky smell to it. So we got one on the 2nd floor over looking the pool with sunlight. It was great. Clean, a tv with movies running on a loop for those who need a chillout session awayf rom the hustle and bustle (you can request movies for the evening at front desk) There were a few Aussie yobbos about, harmless, having a good time. Occasionally embarrasing. That aside, We did meet some great people there, someone to hang with at the bar, have a laugh or play cards on thebalcony.Breakfast was included, not the gourmet bufffet you'd get at the Padma, but for the price you pay it was good. Main staples were: Toast, eggs any style, fruit, pastries, dredful coffee, sometimes bacon, pancakes, always an indonesian dish, either rice or noodles - YUM! Go local I say.All in all - it was a great experience, great value - haggle at the front desk. We paid USD$25 a night with breakfast. Cheap room service.
Reviews.Author: vicsta
